ai-ud6.7:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud6.7:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Sāriputta was sitting not far from the Buddha cross-legged, with his body straight, having attained the immersion free of placing the mind.
ai-ud6.7:2.1_0: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
ai-ud6.7:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud6.7:4.1_0: “In whom mental vibrations are cleared away,
ai-ud6.7:4.4_0: having overcome the four yokes, they are not born again.”
